Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Planetarium \Plan`e*ta"ri*um\, n. [NL.: cf. F. plan['e]taire. See {Planetary}.] An orrery. See {Orrery}. [1913 Webster]

planetarium n 1: a building housing an instrument for projecting the positions of the planets onto a domed ceiling 2: an optical device for projecting images of celestial bodies and other astronomical phenomena onto the inner surface of a hemispherical dome 3: an apparatus or model for representing the solar systems [also: {planetaria} (pl)]
